entries.femaleVariant: Y'know, sometimes I think Night City's kind of a shithole... But I'll tell ya – the grass ain't greener anywhere else. Don't believe me? Then it's time for "Bullshit Bulletin."
At the 74th meeting of the CPSU, the Reds announced a new five-year plan prepared by "Geroi-2" – some AI they bolted together in Pskov.
They unloaded on this poor "Geroi" all the Soviets' stickiest problems left to solve – persistent shortages, catastrophic pollution, and the undying legacy of the combover.
Meanwhile, up on the Moon, the economy continues its nosedive following the price collapse of the Cheese Rock's main export, Helium-3.
Chair of the Lunar Association of H-3 Producers, Julien Adebayo, said he's actively seeking new markets for their stock. Time being, doesn't seem he's having much luck.
In England, four members of the royal family suffered severe chemical burns when they got dumped on by hyper-acidic rain while out galavanting on a fox hunt.
For you uncultured folks unfamiliar with English customs, fox-hunting is a treasured pastime of the aristocracy. Like beating the help... Or incest.
Now, don't know if you heard, but Venezuela's battling another wave of huge forest fires. The state's coca crop got hit hard, with losses estimated at about 8 billion eddies.
Once the blaze was extinguished, thousands of people flocked from Caracas to help in the cleanup effort. Really, these selfless acts of solidarity bring a tear to my eye.
All right, that's it for today's "Bullshit Bulletin." Until next time!
